meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: HOT OR NOT

div.a: Science Says Mitt's Hot, Paul's Not

div.div: A team of Harvard professors has come up with some very interesting findings: Mitt Romney is quite handsome. His running mate, however, might be less so.
HOT FLASHES

div.a: Fantastic New Video Shows Huge Eruption

div.div: NASA'S Solar Dynamic Observatory captured a dramatic filament eruption. Shown in extreme ultraviolet light, the filament collapsed and exploded in spectacular fashion.
FAME IS A FICKLE FRIEND

div.a: No Hollywood Walk Of Fame Star For Kim Kardashian

div.div: Receiving a star requires "a career in the business of acting."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ORsLc9&via=Digg&text=No Hollywood Walk Of Fame Star For Kim Kardashian

div.div: BECAUSE WAITING IS SEXY

div.a: Why You Should Wait To Have Sex

div.div: Couples who leap into bed together on the first date are less likely to have long and happy relationships.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T8JLNw&via=Digg&text=Why You Should Wait To Have Sex

div.div: SCRAMBLES
What happens when you spill 770 pounds of eggs on a Chinese street?

li.div: 770 pounds of eggs smashed.Police have appealed for toast. boingboing.net/2012/09/02/chin...

div.div: MORE STREAMS PLEASE
Now called "Sports Live Extra," the new app is promising streams fro a wider athletic universe.
TIME TO PAY THE PRICE

div.a: The Era Of Cheap Food May Be Over

div.div: A spike in prices caused by poor harvests and rising demand is an apt moment for the west to reassess the wisdom of biofuels.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TMqy1F&via=Digg&text=The Era Of Cheap Food May Be Over

div.div: SEAT'S TAKEN

div.a: Obama's Response To Clint Eastwood Was The Most RT'd Tweet Of RNC

div.div: President Obama's response to Clint Eastwood's speech to an empty chair was the most re-tweeted tweet of the Republican convention, according to a Twitter spokesperson.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qdk8Ku&via=Digg&text=Obama's Response To Clint Eastwood Was The Most RT'd Tweet Of RNC

div.div: ANIMALS

div.a: The Dog That Works To Save The Whales

div.div: A dog named Tucker, with a mysterious past as a stray on the streets of Seattle, is the world’s only working dog able to find and track the scent of orca scat.

li.div: I can't get one of my dogs to stop pooping in the house & they trained this one to track whales? http://t.co/oe9lpeCo

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T8O3EF&via=Digg&text=The Dog That Works To Save The Whales

div.div: LONG READS

Every year, hundreds of children in Texas are abducted by a parent and taken to Mexico. Most of the left-behind parents don’t know where to turn for help, and many law enforcement agencies don’t know how to help them.
QUESTIONS YOU WERE TOO DRUNK TO ASK

div.a: How Does Alcohol Get You Drunk?

div.div: There's a whole lot of things that people stuff in their faces. Some of them keep those people alive. Some of them taste good to those people. Alcohol does neither of those things. Why do people keep putting it in their bodies?
IT'S AN EPIDEMIC

div.a: The Truth About Why We Laugh

div.div: Plato and Aristotle saw it as a tool to topple the mighty. It often accompanies gruesome acts of cruelty. Most of us will use it more routinely – to win friendship and love. So what lies behind the apparent spontaneity of laughter?

li.div: Laughter is a rich source of information about complex social relationships, if you know where to look. guardian.co.uk/books/2012/...

div.div: WHAT IS A PROFIT?

div.a: IBM Envisions Watson as Supercharged Siri for Businesses

div.div: IBM researchers spent four years developing Watson, the computer smart enough to beat the champions of the quiz show “Jeopardy!” Now they’re trying to figure out how to get those capabilities into the phone in your pocket.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OG3AcJ&via=Digg&text=IBM Envisions Watson as Supercharged Siri for Businesses

div.div: TOURISM

div.a: Human Safaris May Be Banned, But Still Tourists Flock To Andaman Islands

div.div: Eight months after the Observer revealed the shocking story of how tourists were paying to gawp at reclusive tribe, Gethin Chamberlin returns to find the practice still goes on.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RxalMd&via=Digg&text=Human Safaris May Be Banned, But Still Tourists Flock To Andaman Islands

div.div: BEATS FLYING COACH

div.a: Boeing Installs First Aeroloft Sleeping Area

div.div: If you’re rich, you fly in a small private jet. If you’re a head of state, however, you might opt for your own 747 with an eight-person sleeping area called the Aeroloft.
